xxl.core.predicates
Class BindingPredicate<P>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.predicates.Predicate<P>
      xxl.core.predicates.BindingPredicate<P>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Binding<P>
public class BindingPredicate<P>
extends Predicate<P>
implements Binding<P>

This class provides a predicate whose arguments are partially bound to some constant objects.

Example:
Consider the predicate Less that returns true if the first argument is less than the second. By creating a BindingPredicate instance 

   Predicate<Integer> p = new BindingPredicate<Integer>(
       new Less<Integer>(
           new ComparableComparator<Integer>()
       ),
       Arrays.asList(0),
       Arrays.asList(42)
   );
p can be evaluated by calling 
   p.invoke(new 2);               //predicate: 42 < 2
which corresponds to the call 
   p.invoke(42, 2);               //predicate: 42 < 2

See Also:
LeftBind, RightBind, Serialized Form

Field Detail

predicate

protected Predicate<? super P> predicate
These objects are used as constant objects of this predicate's invoke methods. The important is that the attribute constIndices should always be sorted(!).

Arguments for binding.

public BindingPredicate(Predicate<? super P> predicate,
                        List<Integer> constIndices,
                        List<? extends P> constArguments)
Creates a new predicate which binds a part of the arguments of the specified predicate to the given constant objects.

Parameters:
predicate - the predicate whose arguments should be partially bound.
constIndices - the indices of the arguments which should be bound.
constArguments - the constant arguments to be used in the predicate.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples of how to use a BindingPredicate. It can also be used to test the functionality of a BindingPredicate.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
